Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?

The Role

Description:
ShopFully is the tech company reinventing local shopping worldwide.

Thanks to our marketplaces we enable 45+ million users globally to save money and time when shopping at their favourite local stores. Our AI-driven platform helps 400+ retailers and top brands reach their ideal audiences and finally drive them to their stores, boosting local sales. This is why today we are one of the leading international players in Drive to Store.

We’re a team of over 370, spanning 30 different nationalities across 12 countries. Are you ready to join us?

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL

You will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable ETL processes towards the enterprise data warehouse and data lake
You will take care of everything related to the use of data to support the sale and improvement of our products (e.g. search for products loopholes), from the data ingestion phase to the visualization phase
your relational skills will be an advantage in the analysis and definition of data processes that meet business requirements
Our data platform is completely in the AWS cloud, it is modern and inspired by the big technological players and allows us to manage both batch and real-time applications.

SKILLS WE’RE SEARCHING FOR

You have a good knowledge of the SQL language and Python
You have knowledge of the basics of Big Data application development
You have knowledge of the cloud world and in particular AWS
You are able to work in a team and coordinate with multiple internal stakeholders

OTHER ABILITIES THAT WILL WIN OUR HEART

You have knowledge of the basics of the dimensional fact model and data warehousing
You have knowledge of at least one ETL tool (Pentaho Data Integration, Talend, etc.)
PySpark
It should be a plus also if you have knowledge of Tableau and R

THIS IS WHAT YOU’LL FIND IF YOU START THE ADVENTURE WITH US

Zero degrees of separation.
We are very informal, love direct feedback and work by project, so you’ll get a chance to meet everyone. Our CEO, CTO and C-anything will be your colleagues in some activities and you’ll get to work with all of us!

Massive impact.
You’ll work on tech & products that will be used by hundreds of retailers and brands and millions of people (from your friends, to your neighbours, and maybe even your mother!).

Problems that you’ll love to solve.
Here, you’ll discover that every challenge is an opportunity to thrive and make an impact.

The best team you’ve ever met.
We’re young and talented, without being divas, and we are supportive of each other. We share knowledge and are each other’s number one fans.

Learning and growing.
What do you think about 70 hours Learning Time a year and the possibility of getting tech certifications like AWS? But most importantly, at ShopFully you’ll be learning by doing and making mistakes, which will allow you to improve day after day.

Smart working, but even smarter.
each team can choose the ShopFully Hub that suits them better. Rome, Sidney or Barcelona? You’ll be spoilt for choice!

Fun, fun, fun!
It can be a happy hour, a volleyball match, a tandem ride, a Halloween party. You name it!

Lunches on us.
We give meal vouchers, also while working remotely. It’s a little thing, but we want to take care of it.

Job_title: Mobility Analytics Product Engineer & Data Scientist
Description:
Job ID: 2023-05
Location: Madrid, Spain
Job Type: Full time
The planning and management of transport infrastructures and services requires accurate, reliable, and updated information about the presence and mobility patterns of the population. In recent years, the pervasive use of geolocated devices in our daily activities has enabled new forms of collecting this information. The abundance of data opens exciting opportunities, but it also requires the development of advanced methods and algorithms for the analysis and fusion of heterogeneous data sources, including data from mobile network operators, GPS traces, ticketing systems and traffic counts.
Over the past decade, Nommon has been a pioneer in the application of big data to travel behaviour analysis. Since its creation in 2015, our Mobility Analytics business unit has developed a variety of cutting-edge solutions that mine and analyse anonymised geolocation data from mobile devices and blend them with other data provided by our clients or available from public databases to provide high-quality trip matrices and other mobility indicators. An ambitious research and development strategy has put Nommon at the forefront of innovation in the mobility analytics market and has led to continuous growth. As part of our expansion plan for 2023, .

Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

Summary / Role Purpose
The successful candidate will join a dynamic team responsible for research, design, and development of state-of-the-art software for electronics reliability analysis. The R&D Engineer II contributes to the development of Ansys Sherlock and supporting systems. In this role, the R&D Engineer II will collaborate with a team of expert professionals to understand customer requirements and accomplish development objectives.

Hos Intrum vil du udvikle dig ved at gøre en forskel – på såvel højt plan som i et internationalt miljø. Og dét i en bekræftende kultur, hvor din indsats tæller.
At Intrum, you will grow by making a difference. You will do it in a highly international environment and in a supportive and innovative culture.
As a market-leading credit management company, Intrum has wide-ranging expertise in debt collection services, and we do business in 24 countries in Europe.
We have more than 10,000 experienced employees in our group. As a result, we have a unique geographical size and scope.
With market leadership however, comes great responsibility. We see ourselves as role models within our industry and have both the opportunity and responsibility to set new standards and change the way people perceive credit management. Through ethical and sustainable business practices we want to become the true benchmark of our industry.
Being part of an exciting journey, Intrum is working on developing global processes for all Intrum countries.

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.
As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.
Education & Experience:

Description:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 50,000+ tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, students have signed up to more than 15 million lessons.
Meet the team!
Here in Preply, we a/b test most of our changes on production, both product and technical before scaling it to all customers. Experimentation Squad owns the whole infrastructure that is used to make those business-vital decisions.
You, as a part of the Experimentation Squad, will develop systems that are used by all product and platform squads in their daily work in the decision-making process; figure out how to apply novel experimentation methodologies for the Preply problems; tackle problems that occur in highly loaded systems, such as cross-experiment correlation, data consistency, event deduplication, etc.; design and monitor applications in a way that will guarantee stability and reliability.
Pros: ['"People are allowed to be people and have fun at work." (in 4 reviews)', '"The company has so many different opportunities to grow, company speed, and an open mind to new challenges is impressive." (in 3 reviews)']
Cons: ['"The company is really ambitious, but that rush impacts on people and their mood, people burnout and leave the company." (in 2 reviews)']

Job_title: Lead Data Engineer (Google Cloud, Scala, CI/CD)
Description:
Job Description:
Job Description
Dow Jones is seeking an engineer with extremely strong engineering skills to join a newly formed team, created as part of a strategic initiative that has identified some high growth opportunities for the organization. You'll also be working on market-leading flagship products on the latest in the Scala tech stack.
The team’s overarching goal is to develop a new generation of knowledge products, powered by technologies such as graph databases, ML/AI and cloud computing, aimed at extreme information users, both internally (e.g. in our newsrooms and Data Strategy teams) and externally. The team will seek to interconnect and harness all data and content available to Dow Jones and help our customers make sense in near-real time of how news events are impacting their world.

Description:
Data Engineer (I&D)
¡Hola! Somos CAPGEMINI
Tenemos la gran suerte de trabajar en un sector que lidera la evolución hacia un futuro sostenible e inclusivo. La TECNOLOGÍA. El catalizador de tantas soluciones que necesitamos ahora más que nunca.
Somos 300.000 PERSONAS en todo el mundo unidas por una misma pasión.
No importa dónde estemos, podemos estar en casa, en la oficina, a mil quilómetros de distancia unxs de otrxs, pero somos conscientes de que NUESTRO TRABAJO CUENTA.
No importa en qué momento vital estemos, somos DIVERSOS en edad, género, ascendencia, familia… ¡nos hemos certificado en Diversidad y como empresa ÉTICA más de 9 años seguidos!
No importa si tu fase es de crecimiento, APRENDIENDO y FORMÁNDOTE a todas horas o si necesitas consolidarte y aprecias la FLEXIBILIDAD, la CONCILIACION y los BENEFICIOS fiscales y sociales para compaginar tu vida personal y profesional. Lo que importa es que puedes sentir que estás DONDE DEBES ESTAR para conseguir el futuro que deseas.
En cuanto al equipo, vas a poder trabajar con equipos diversos, para cada proyecto se constituye un equipo diferente, de distintas ciudades, por lo que tendrás relación con personas que están más allá de tu centro de trabajo o de tu lugar de residencia. Piensa que también colaboramos con otras sedes de Capgemini a nivel mundial… así que tu red de colegas no tendrá límite!!
Nuestro objetivo es poder brindar a nuestros clientes herramientas que le ayuden a tener éxito y conseguir sus propios objetivos. ¿Cómo? A través de nuestra excelencia en conocimiento y metodología, nuestra expertise y nuestro estilo de relación colaborativa con los clientes.

Job_title: Director, Go to Market Strategy and Transformation - REMOTE or FLEX
Description:
Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better.

As the global market leader in simulation software, Ansys is growing our Go-to-Market Strategy and Transformation team. The Director, GTM Strategy and Transformation will join a growing team of strategy and transformation professionals within our commercial organization and will play a pivotal role in working closely with our C-level executive team to shape and enhance Ansys’s GTM strategy. Description:
Audiense is an equal opportunity employer, and we know it's our differences that makes us great, so we want to welcome people from all backgrounds to our family. We encourage Black, Brown, LQBTQ+, Disabled, Mums and Dads to apply!

During the application process please feel free to share which pronouns you use (she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs). And please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for the application or the interview.
The challenge
At Audiense we process more than one thousand million social profiles. We enrich them by applying several classification and segmentation algorithms to help customers such as Twitter, Telefónica, DHL, and Puma to define their marketing campaigns, identify influencers and discover new market niches.

Our challenge is to optimise the intake, enriching and storage of that growing data asset and to bring the insights computing to be as close as possible to real time.

For that we have a pipeline that ingests data from an enriching system mainly written in Node.js. This system consumes from many third party APIs and applies algorithms to infer new characteristics. This pipeline is able to keep updating a data lake of more than 100 TB that is used to generate reports for our customers using Spark and Scala.

Most of the Data Engineering code base is written in Scala, Spark and Typescript. This codebase is used both for maintaining our data lake and consuming it.

Our current focus is migrating and refactoring all the legacy parts of the batch-oriented ETL pipeline that feeds our data lake to a more real-time, event-oriented architecture based on Kafka.

In order to tackle this challenge, we are looking for people that will feel comfortable with the wide range of skills involved, someone that will add their experience to ours and help us fill the gaps by joining our team.

All our stack is hosted in AWS, we use mainly Docker (ECS), EC2 and Lambda to execute our source code and a wide range of services like SQS and SNS for communication via events.

Description:
The i2CAT Foundation is looking for a Junior Data Engineer who is eager to get involved in exciting R&I projects in the fields of distributed data infrastructures and Data Spaces.
The suitable candidate will join the Distributed Artificial Intelligence (DAI) research area, and will work alongside a 15 member team of data engineers and data scientists with expertise in AI, Deep Learning and Disitrbuted Data Infrastuctures. DAI is an active player in the local and European R&I ecosystem and works in multiple verticals such as mobility, inustry, manufacturing and cybersecurity.
The selected candidate will start out working on the development of a Data Space testbed that streamlines data preprocessing and sharing between different actors, guaranteeing the security and privacy of the data at all times. The project will include the development of multiple components that permit this new paradigm of data sharing as well as the implementation of multiple pilots and use cases with our wide-ranging network of partners from the public and private sector, at both Catalan and European level.

Description:

Actualmente, precisamos incorporar perfiles de Data Engineer para integrarse en sus oficinas de Madrid, Barcelona y Bilbao.

¿Quieres desarrollar tu carrera profesional allí donde hacemos realidad las ideaciones de nuestros clientes mediante el uso de las tecnologías más disruptivas y avanzadas del mercado? ¿Te encanta afrontar nuevos retos tecnológicos y liderar la transformación digital de nuestros clientes? ¿Buscas un ecosistema con proyectos nacionales e internacionales? En el equipo de Specialized Technology Engineering de Deloitte contamos con un grupo de profesionales que se enfrentan constantemente al reto de aplicar tecnologías especializadas de última generación ayudando a nuestros clientes en sus procesos de constante transformación digital. Nuestros profesionales en continua formación, disponen de amplios conocimientos en tecnología del ámbito Cloud, Inteligencia Artificial, el mundo del Dato, Ominicanalidad, Realidad Digital, entre otras. Nuestras metodologías de trabajo ágiles nos permiten, junto a avanzadas herramientas y los aceleradores de desarrollo más punteros del mercado, poner soluciones en manos de nuestros clientes en un tiempo récord.

¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia profesional mínima 1 año en proyectos de transformación de datos a escala masiva basada tanto en servicios Cloud como en herramientas de integración
Utilización de conocimiento previos de herramientas, frameworks y plataformas de integración de datos, para el diseño y la implementación de pipelines de ingestión, transformación, data quality y aprovisionamiento de datos en diferentes ecosistemas (Cloud, Onprem, Big Data, EDW, etc.)
Data Pipelines (ETL, Ingestion, etc.), Data Quality, Data Profiling, Data Lineage, Gluecode Mastery, Cloudera & Hortonworks (Ecosistema Hadoop), Amazon (Lambda, Glue, S3, Kinesis), Azure (Data Factory, Datalake, Databricks, Deltalake), GCP (Cloud Storage, Dataproc, Dataflow), SQL (Oracle, MSSQL, MySQL, etc.) Shellscripting, Linux & Windows platforms, Informatica DEI, DQ Kafka (+Kafka Connect, +KafkaSQL)
Ingenierías o Grados en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas o titulaciones técnicas similares
Nivel de inglés Alto
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y de espíritu de equipo

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Forma parte de Deloitte, una compañía multidisciplinar en la que desarrollarás todo tu talento. What impact will you make?

Deloitte es una Firma de servicios profesionales firmemente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades. En este sentido, la Firma aceptará y tramitará solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad, no discriminando por motivos de sexo, expresión de género, raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, enfermedad o condición de salud, predisposición genética a sufrir patologías, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación o identidad sexual, situación socioeconómica o cualquier otra condición o circunstancia personal o social.

Description:
Do you really want the perfect job? Or do you want the next step in your career to be deeply impactful? I can’t offer you perfect, but I can offer deep impact. I have a successful 11-year-old SaaS product that needs awesome skillsets (maybe yours?) to reach new heights. As a team we’re killing it in DE for our niche, but we have a lofty road map ahead of us (#disruptUSA) and a bus with a few key seats we still need to fill.

Still reading? Awesome. Let me intro myself, hi my name is Remo. I’m the co-founder of ProvenExpert. You will be working closely with me; therefore, I want to give you context on us, what the role is about and what we’re looking for.

Me and my colleagues are fighting for the little (wo)man – the small business owners and one-(wo)man-bands who grind each and every day to master their craft. They want to focus on delivering outstanding work and getting more clients – not sales and marketing. That’s where we come in as ProvenExpert – we provide a SaaS platform for small business owners to manage feedback and enable them to direct their online reputation.

Are you ready for a challenging and exciting career in the world of data? Do you want to help shape the future of our reputation management platforms while working closely with our talented team? Then we are looking for exactly you! We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer (m/f/d) to help us optimize our data infrastructure and develop innovative solutions for our customers. As a Data Engineer (m/f/d) at ProvenExpert, you will play a critical role in driving our data strategy and ensuring data quality and availability for our teams and customers. You will work closely with various departments to understand their requirements and develop customized solutions to support the success of our business.

Tasks

Where your expertise is needed ⭐️

Requirements

Description:
Hotelbeds is the world’s leading technology partner, connecting and empowering the world of travel. Our people, Team Hotelbeds, are the beating heart of the company who we encourage to ‘move fast, dream big and make the difference’ every day. In fact, we believe that it is tech + data + people that truly sets us apart in the market, alongside our ‘global approach, local touch’ mentality. We’re headquartered in Palma, Mallorca and employ around 3,500 people worldwide.

At Data & Performance team of Schneider Electric, we are building Intel Data Store (IntelDS), a global Data Lake for enterprise data. It is a Big Data platform fully hosted on AWS and connected today to more than 40 data sources.

Connecting new sources to enrich the data scope of the platform.

Prepare data and make it available in an efficient and optimized format for our different data consumers, ranging from BI and analytics to data science applications. Job_title: Intern Data Scientist / Software Engineer - Spanish Speaking (End-of-studies)
Description:
Did you know that about 10% of all insurance payouts are flowing directly into the pockets of fraudsters? The future of insurance starts with Decisions Made Better.
Shift Technology harnesses the power of AI to enable the world's leading insurance organizations to make better decisions. Our products automate and optimize decisions from underwriting to claims, resulting in increased operational efficiency, reduced costs, and superior customer experiences for millions of people around the globe.
Our culture is built on innovation, trust, and a drive to transform the insurance industry by imagining and innovating solutions that impact insurers and their customers - like you! We come from more than 40 different countries and cultures and together we are creating the future of insurance.
The Data Science team works on a broad range of subjects. We actively participate in the definition and development of our suite of products on fraud detection, anti-money laundering and claim automation. We have a lot of technical and professional experience in data science, data engineering, coding, business understanding and client interactions. Additionally, we also work on various data types such as structured data, free text, documents and images.

Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

Do you share our passion for data? Execution management and process mining cannot happen without our digital clone process. This is an unparalleled opportunity to explore and experience various databases and their data structures, with focus on integrity. Our data teams that focus on ingestion and transformation are critical to our core product. They work with a vast variety of unique input sources to ensure we capture and transform our partner data in a way that can bring value to the user. They continuously anticipate the problems that can be caused by data sources and their associated data types, and have a deep understanding of the end goals of process mining and the end user goals. They work closely across teams supporting the end-to-end process, and work with multiple technologies to ensure performance, scalability, and data integrity.

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.

As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.

Description:
Descripción
Nuestro equipo de NATEEVO en Colombia crece y te estamos buscando .

¡NATEEVO sigue creciendo!

NATEEVO, empresa de GrupoVASS, se construye desde el TALENTO, con equipos de buenos profesionales, a la vez que profesionales buenos, con mucha auto-exigencia, compañerismo, pasión y crecimiento continuo para aportar el máximo valor al negocio. No nos conformamos con lo que somos hoy y nuestro gen NATEEVO nos lleva a seguirnos desarrollando día a día, y a asumir retos cada vez más complejos y desafiantes en el ecosistema digital.

Desde la tecnología como piedra angular, y la estrategia digital como punta de lanza, trabajamos los proyectos con equipos multidisciplinares con expertise en todo el amplio abanico del ecosistema Digital; Analítica, User Experiece, SEO, SEM, Social Media, Marketing Automation, Gestión del cambio, Diseño, Brand…

Somos un equipo de más de 260 personas volcadas en ayudar a nuestros partners a ser mejores empresas, con la digitalización como punto de referencia.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

¡Bienvenido a tu futuro !
Requisitos
En NATEEVO nos encontramos en la búsqueda de una persona encargado de entender el negocio y sus datos mediante la exploración, extracción, transformación y carga de los mismos contribuyendo de esta manera con el análisis para una
mejor toma de decisiones.



Desarrollar y dar mantenimiento a la solución de flujo de datos usando los servicios de Azure.
Extraer datos estructurados y no estructurados de un data warehouse
Construir tuberías de datos (data pipelines) robustas y escalables
Ejecutar las transformaciones necesarias para limpieza de datos
Cargar data transformada a sistemas de personalización y/o marketing
Automation para que la data sea aprovechada por el equipo operativo
Verificar la calidad y consistencia de los datos (input y output) comparando distintas fuentes.
Optimización de procesos, automatización y documentación de los mismos


PySpark, Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-Learn, Plotly o similares
Bases de datos SQL y NoSQL
Experiencia con Oracle SQL
RegEx
Git

Si te ha llamado la atención, déjanos conocerte clicando en “solicitar una evaluación” . Si tu perfil tiene un buen encaje con todo lo que te hemos contado nos pondremos en contacto contigo a través de una breve llamada para conocerte mejor desde el equipo de Talent y después conocerás a alguien del equipo de tu futura área.

Description:
Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Yugabyte, Spark and Kafka, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis, MongoDB and Opensearch, all the way to structured SQL engines like PostgreSQL and MySQL.
This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about delivering high quality, reliable and automated infrastructure based on open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.
Experience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technologies.

Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker develops high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions that enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years and today, Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems, and a strong reputation among its customers. Worldwide, more than 7,500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations on all continents.

Acuity Spatial Genomics, Inc. is commercializing one of the most powerfully advantageous approaches in spatial biology. The Company brings together the premier spatial omics approach with leading-edge data acquisition and analysis capability. The pioneering in situ technology enables examination of some of the most important questions in genomics and gene expression at the single cell and sub-cellular level. We aim to find the best talent in the field to join and contribute to this extraordinary, exciting endeavor becoming a critical member of this groundbreaking opportunity.

Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world, competing with American-based Liftoff and Korean-based Moloco, both in the pre-IPO stage and averaging about $500M in yearly revenues.
We are looking for a Junior Programmatic Ad Operations Analyst with strong Microsoft Excel and analytics experience to join our Ad Operations team. Working alongside our Programmatic Campaign Managers, the candidate should have a mix of business-oriented and analytical mindset, to understand the short and long term challenges the mobile advertising campaigns are facing, and use the tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them and create the most effective strategies and algorithms to help improve the Smadex platform!

Description:
Descripción
Desde Azertium IT nos gustaría contar con los mejores profesionales del sector, y actualmente, estamos en búsqueda de un Data Engineer con al menos 2 años de experiencia laboral, para formar parte de nuestro equipo, con gran desarrollo profesional.

Modalidad de trabajo hibrido: 50% es teletrabajo y 50% presencial - zona centro Madrid.

Es necesario estar viviendo en España y tener permiso de trabajo (en caso de ser extranjero).

Sportserve forms part of a remarkable group of GameTech companies, focused on delivering first class gaming experiences, sports-betting and casino products for our users worldwide.
Along with Sportion, TechSpirit, Standard Focus and Sportelligent, we are the driving force behind the world renowned sports betting brand, Dafabet.
Since launching our global hiring initiative, we now employ over 2,000 people worldwide. Offering office based, hybrid and remote work on permanent and consultancy contracts all over the world, making us the true global employer of choice.

General Duties & Responsibilities

¿Quieres desarrollar tu carrera profesional allí donde hacemos realidad las ideaciones de nuestros clientes mediante el uso de las tecnologías más disruptivas y avanzadas del mercado? ¿Te encanta afrontar nuevos retos tecnológicos y liderar la transformación digital de nuestros clientes? ¿Buscas un ecosistema con proyectos nacionales e internacionales?

En el equipo de Artificial Intelligence & Data del Delivery Center de Deloitte contamos con un grupo de profesionales que se enfrentan constantemente al reto de aplicar tecnologías especializadas de última generación ayudando a nuestros clientes en sus procesos de constante transformación digital. Nuestros profesionales en continua formación disponen de amplios conocimientos en tecnologías del ámbito Cloud, Inteligencia Artificial y el mundo del Dato. Nuestras metodologías de trabajo ágiles nos permiten, junto a avanzadas herramientas y los aceleradores de desarrollo más punteros del mercado, poner soluciones en manos de nuestros clientes en un tiempo récord.

Actualmente, precisamos incorporar un/a Data Engineer con PySpark para integrarse en nuestro equipo de Deloitte de manera indefinida.

¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia profesional mínima 1 año en la transformación de datos a escala masiva basada tanto en servicios cloud como heramientas de integración de datos.
Python, Spark, PySpark.
Ingenierías o Grados en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas o Estadística.
Nivel de inglés alto, mínimo B2
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y espíritu de equipo.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico y flexible.
Disfrutar de 22 días de vacaciones además de 5 días en Navidad, 4 días en Semana Santa y jornada intensiva del 1 de Julio al 15 de septiembre.
Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
Participar en actividades y eventos extralaborales (Concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.

Estudios requeridos

Titulado universitario (en el ámbito de la ingeniería, telecomunicaciones, matemáticas, física...) o Ciclo de grado superior (en desarrollo de aplicaciones multiplataformas, desarrollo de aplicaciones web, ASIR o acorde)

Experiencia requerida

A partir de 2 años de experiencia (valorable a partir de 1 año)

Si quieres ver cómo tu trabajo tiene un impacto real en los clientes y personas, te gustan los retos tecnológicos y crees que nunca se deja de aprender… ¡Deloitte es tu sitio!

¿Aceptas el desafío?

Deloitte es una Firma de servicios profesionales firmemente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades. En este sentido, la Firma aceptará y tramitará solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad, no discriminando por motivos de sexo, expresión de género, raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, enfermedad o condición de salud, predisposición genética a sufrir patologías, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación o identidad sexual, situación socioeconómica o cualquier otra condición o circunstancia personal o social.
Sevilla
Profesionales Con Experiencia
Consultoría
27982

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.

As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.

Education & Experience:

Description:
EPAM is the foremost global digital transformation services provider with over 59,000 EPAMers in more than 50 countries. Since 1993, our multidisciplinary teams have been helping make the future real for our clients and communities around the world. Are you an open-minded professional with hands-on experience in Databricks or similar ETL Tools? If it sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Data Engineer. As part of this project, our Data teams are working on migration of Data Products pipelines from Oracle workloads to Databricks. The team is composed of 3 engineers, 2 analysts and a Product Manager working in a highly agile environment, following XP practices and best CI/CD practices.

Description:
Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

Description:
Estarás en el equipo de Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence. Es un equipo joven centrado en dos líneas de especialización. La línea de diseño y desarrollo de arquitecturas de datos cloud y la de Data analytics y generación de modelos de IA. En el equipo combinamos ambos perfiles para llevar a producción toda la analítica de datos, así como la automatización del ciclo de vida del dato y los modelos. Con la incorporación de un data engineer queremos reforzar la primera de las líneas para desarrollar plataformas digitales en múltiples proveedores cloud como AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform, u on-premise.
Tus funciones serán:
Construir pipelines de datos para adquirir datos de diversas fuentes.
Diseñar, desarrollar y supervisar el procesamiento de datos en un proyecto de Big Data.

Workfully is building a new category of Talent Acquisition products. We enable companies to hire for potential and teach skills later. Also, we enable the fastest-growing companies to hire senior talent globally, through our network of top TA partners.
For our HireSkilling Program, we are looking for a new Trainer in Data Engineering and other technical subjects. Our training programs are used as a Talent Acquisition tool for Europe's top employers and cover all stages of the talent cycle, from attraction to on-the-job coaching.
The trainer will be responsible for adapting, planning, and delivering approximately 4 weeks, of remote, training programs in Data engineering and other topics.

Description
Esta es tu oportunidad para unirte a un equipo diverso de personas apasionadas por el Big Data.
En buenas manos ¡las tuyas! las enormes cantidades de información que las empresas recopilan hoy pueden convertirse en un activo muy valioso manejadas estratégicamente. Description:
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.
The Role
Veeva Link supports the life sciences industry to connect with key people to improve research and care. It helps professionals to find the right people for e.g. clinical trials, education programs, or advisory boards. This streamlined access helps to reduce the time-to-market of important drugs, conduct trials with the most relevant experts in the respective field, and spread information about new treatments to key people in the life science community. You can read more about Veeva Link on our product pages.

Job_title: Fullstack Software Engineer – Physical Meeting Points, Group Digital, Madrid
Description: If you are an amazing Software Engineer who wants to make a significant and meaningful contribution at an amazing company, then keep reading! WHO WE ARE Hi! I am Carlos and I lead a team as Engineering Manager at Ingka Digital (IKEA). We are looking for passionate engineers who are excited about technology and innovative ways of working and want to be a part of shaping the future of IKEA stores! Our team is responsible for developing digital solutions that will provide convenient, inspiring, and fun shopping experiences to our customers in our Physical Meeting Points (PMP). Also, we plan to transform and enhance processes for our co-workers in the IKEA stores. We are building a winning team with a clear mission and priorities! We are agile and adapt fast to changes. Engineers are not only delivering solutions but are also a part the core product team. Everything that we work on has great customer impact. We encourage every individual in the team to take part in and become customer obsessed. All this is done in an open and transparent way where trust is key and something we live by. Come join a growing team where you will have real customer impact! WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING Designing and implementing the backend services, frontend UI, data models, messaging and API specs. Developing high quality code using and applying good practices. Establishing standards and patterns, advocate adoption of technology both internally and towards the user groups in the PMP area. Working in an Agile way and with a DevOps mindset. Cross-team collaboration between web, app, cloud & backend, and embedded systems. Driving the product discovery, development and operation process within a multidisciplinary team (Product, Data, UX and Engineering) while contributing to the design and deployment of IKEA Digital In-Store solutions. WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU You share our vision of becoming the world’s leading multichannel home furnishing retailer and you believe good software is an essential ingredient of achieving that vision. We believe you have a great understanding of what simplicity and togetherness means. You know when to take and to give responsibility for what needs to be done. You care about your team and its software, and you continuously push for improvements in quality and speed. Together we will design, develop, deploy, release, run and support our applications. YOUR SKILLS INCLUDE: • Good experience in software engineering.• Experienced in JavaScript (NodeJS/React), Python, or other programming languages.• Interested with building microservices using cloud solutions (Serverless preferably on GCP)• Experience with web development and good understanding of API design.• Experience in working with GitHub, CI/CD, DevOps and Agile.• Experience with both SQL and NoSQL DBs. ABOUT THE TEAM We are based in Madrid (Spain), but also have fully remote team members distributed across Malmö/Helsingborg (Sweden), Amsterdam (Netherlands) and other parts of Europe. From now on we plan to meetup once or twice a week at the Madrid Digital Hub (San Sebastian de Los Reyes, Madrid). We are a new but rapid growing team (our hub was founded less than 2 years ago!). I love that together with our Data/UX/Product colleagues are able to prove new business and technology concepts in the IKEA stores across the globe and iterate and progressively create value for our customers and co-workers. So would you! Some of the perks that we offer: • A friendly workplace where you can always be yourself• Equal pay (Our salaries are set independently of race, gender, age or other individual characteristics)• Continuous learning on the job as well as structured trainings and platforms• Co-worker discount• Access to health insurance• World’s greatest colleagues And many more… :) QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT! If you have any questions about the position, please reach out to hiring manager Carlos Celorrio at carlos.celorrio@ingka.ikea.com. If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to Warren Roach at warren.roach@ingka.com. Warmly welcome with your application! Please note:Our primary concern since the outbreak of corona virus has been the health and safety of our co-workers and candidates. Because of this, we have adapted our recruiting processes to be fully digital. We would love to meet our candidates face to face, but to prevent the spread of the virus this recruitment will be handled through digital appointments and solutions.

Description:
¿Quieres desarrollar tu carrera profesional allí donde hacemos realidad las ideaciones de nuestros clientes mediante el uso de las tecnologías más disruptivas y avanzadas del mercado? ¿Te encanta afrontar nuevos retos tecnológicos y liderar la transformación digital de nuestros clientes? ¿Buscas un ecosistema con proyectos nacionales e internacionales?

En el equipo de Artificial Intelligence & Data del Delivery Center de Deloitte contamos con un grupo de profesionales que se enfrentan constantemente al reto de aplicar tecnologías especializadas de última generación ayudando a nuestros clientes en sus procesos de constante transformación digital. Nuestros profesionales en continua formación disponen de amplios conocimientos en tecnologías del ámbito Cloud, Inteligencia Artificial y el mundo del Dato. Nuestras metodologías de trabajo ágiles nos permiten, junto a avanzadas herramientas y los aceleradores de desarrollo más punteros del mercado, poner soluciones en manos de nuestros clientes en un tiempo récord.

Actualmente, precisamos incorporar un/a Data Engineer con PySpark para integrarse en nuestro equipo de Deloitte de manera indefinida.

¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia profesional mínima 1 año en la transformación de datos a escala masiva basada tanto en servicios cloud como heramientas de integración de datos.
Python, Spark, PySpark.
Ingenierías o Grados en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas o Estadística.
Nivel de inglés alto, mínimo B2
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y espíritu de equipo.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico y flexible.
Disfrutar de 22 días de vacaciones además de 5 días en Navidad, 4 días en Semana Santa y jornada intensiva del 1 de Julio al 15 de septiembre.
Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
Participar en actividades y eventos extralaborales (Concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.

Estudios requeridos

Titulado universitario (en el ámbito de la ingeniería, telecomunicaciones, matemáticas, física...) o Ciclo de grado superior (en desarrollo de aplicaciones multiplataformas, desarrollo de aplicaciones web, ASIR o acorde)

Experiencia requerida

A partir de 2 años de experiencia (valorable a partir de 1 año)

Si quieres ver cómo tu trabajo tiene un impacto real en los clientes y personas, te gustan los retos tecnológicos y crees que nunca se deja de aprender… ¡Deloitte es tu sitio!

¿Aceptas el desafío?

Deloitte es una Firma de servicios profesionales firmemente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades. En este sentido, la Firma aceptará y tramitará solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad, no discriminando por motivos de sexo, expresión de género, raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, enfermedad o condición de salud, predisposición genética a sufrir patologías, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación o identidad sexual, situación socioeconómica o cualquier otra condición o circunstancia personal o social.

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.

As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.

Description:
HP is a $58+ billion fortune 100 company with 50,000+ employees worldwide across 170 countries. Reinventing since 1939. We are one of the leading Print and Personal Systems technology companies in the world and our vision is to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.
At HP Sant Cugat (Barcelona), we have an impressive 2300+ employees, made up of 60+ different nationalities. We host 12 businesses and are the worldwide HQ of the 3D Printing and the Large Format Printing businesses and the EMEA HQ for the Graphics Solutions Business. We also have the largest HP R&D Lab outside of the US and a fantastic Demo center.

At HP, we believe in the power of ideas. We use ideas to put technology to work for everyone. And we believe that ideas thrive best in a culture of teamwork. That is why everyone - at every level, in every function - is encouraged to have ideas, to express them and to share them. We trust anything can be achieved if you really believe in it, and we will invest in your ideas to change lives and the way people work. This vision is what sets us apart as a company.

Description:
DTN is a global leader providing insights and analytics to our customers to feed, fuel, and protect the world. We help people make critical business decisions that impact the agriculture, oil and gas, trading, and weather industries.

It’s a difference you’ve likely felt without even knowing it. From the food on your plate to the gas in your car to the last flight you took, chances are a DTN customer made it possible. And that’s just for starters. That’s why we say, “When our customers prosper, we all win.”
Job Description:
DTN – Weather Systems seeks a Software Development Engineer. This position plays a key role in building innovative software to deliver mission critical weather information to aeronautical and meteorological clients around the world including airports and national meteorological services.
Our product portfolio includes a market leading meteorological data acquisition, processing, and display software application called MetConsole©. As Software Development Engineer, you will be responsible for the implementation of software of the MetConsole© Aviation Weather Suite of products. Since 1984, DTN has evolved amidst a dynamic, ever-changing marketplace. We have always maintained our customer-centric focus. It is the critical key behind our must-have, best-in-class solutions.

Description:
¿Quieres desarrollar tu carrera profesional allí donde hacemos realidad las ideaciones de nuestros clientes mediante el uso de las tecnologías más disruptivas y avanzadas del mercado? ¿Te encanta afrontar nuevos retos tecnológicos y liderar la transformación digital de nuestros clientes? ¿Buscas un ecosistema con proyectos nacionales e internacionales?

En el equipo de Artificial Intelligence & Data del Delivery Center de Deloitte contamos con un grupo de profesionales que se enfrentan constantemente al reto de aplicar tecnologías especializadas de última generación ayudando a nuestros clientes en sus procesos de constante transformación digital. Nuestros profesionales en continua formación disponen de amplios conocimientos en tecnologías del ámbito Cloud, Inteligencia Artificial y el mundo del Dato. Nuestras metodologías de trabajo ágiles nos permiten, junto a avanzadas herramientas y los aceleradores de desarrollo más punteros del mercado, poner soluciones en manos de nuestros clientes en un tiempo récord.

Actualmente, precisamos incorporar un/a Data Engineer con PySpark para integrarse en nuestro equipo de Deloitte de manera indefinida.

¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia profesional mínima 1 año en la transformación de datos a escala masiva basada tanto en servicios cloud como heramientas de integración de datos.
Python, Spark, PySpark.
Ingenierías o Grados en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas o Estadística.
Nivel de inglés alto, mínimo B2
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y espíritu de equipo.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico y flexible.
Disfrutar de 22 días de vacaciones además de 5 días en Navidad, 4 días en Semana Santa y jornada intensiva del 1 de Julio al 15 de septiembre.
Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
Participar en actividades y eventos extralaborales (Concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.

Estudios requeridos

Titulado universitario (en el ámbito de la ingeniería, telecomunicaciones, matemáticas, física...) o Ciclo de grado superior (en desarrollo de aplicaciones multiplataformas, desarrollo de aplicaciones web, ASIR o acorde)

Experiencia requerida

A partir de 2 años de experiencia (valorable a partir de 1 año)

Si quieres ver cómo tu trabajo tiene un impacto real en los clientes y personas, te gustan los retos tecnológicos y crees que nunca se deja de aprender… ¡Deloitte es tu sitio!

¿Aceptas el desafío?

Deloitte es una Firma de servicios profesionales firmemente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades. En este sentido, la Firma aceptará y tramitará solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad, no discriminando por motivos de sexo, expresión de género, raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, enfermedad o condición de salud, predisposición genética a sufrir patologías, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación o identidad sexual, situación socioeconómica o cualquier otra condición o circunstancia personal o social.

Description:
Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

Description:
Descripción
Desde Azertium IT nos gustaría contar con los mejores profesionales del sector, y actualmente, estamos en búsqueda de un Data Engineer con al menos 2 años de experiencia laboral, para formar parte de nuestro equipo, con gran desarrollo profesional.

Modalidad de trabajo hibrido: 50% es teletrabajo y 50% presencial - zona centro Madrid.

Es necesario estar viviendo en España y tener permiso de trabajo (en caso de ser extranjero).

WHAT YOU'LL DO

GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.

As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.

Education & Experience:

Job_title: Fullstack Software Engineer – Physical Meeting Points, Group Digital, Madrid
Description: If you are an amazing Software Engineer who wants to make a significant and meaningful contribution at an amazing company, then keep reading! WHO WE ARE Hi! I am Carlos and I lead a team as Engineering Manager at Ingka Digital (IKEA). We are looking for passionate engineers who are excited about technology and innovative ways of working and want to be a part of shaping the future of IKEA stores! Our team is responsible for developing digital solutions that will provide convenient, inspiring, and fun shopping experiences to our customers in our Physical Meeting Points (PMP). Also, we plan to transform and enhance processes for our co-workers in the IKEA stores. We are building a winning team with a clear mission and priorities! We are agile and adapt fast to changes. Engineers are not only delivering solutions but are also a part the core product team. Everything that we work on has great customer impact. We encourage every individual in the team to take part in and become customer obsessed. All this is done in an open and transparent way where trust is key and something we live by. Come join a growing team where you will have real customer impact! WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING Designing and implementing the backend services, frontend UI, data models, messaging and API specs. Developing high quality code using and applying good practices. Establishing standards and patterns, advocate adoption of technology both internally and towards the user groups in the PMP area. Working in an Agile way and with a DevOps mindset. Cross-team collaboration between web, app, cloud & backend, and embedded systems. Driving the product discovery, development and operation process within a multidisciplinary team (Product, Data, UX and Engineering) while contributing to the design and deployment of IKEA Digital In-Store solutions. WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU You share our vision of becoming the world’s leading multichannel home furnishing retailer and you believe good software is an essential ingredient of achieving that vision. We believe you have a great understanding of what simplicity and togetherness means. You know when to take and to give responsibility for what needs to be done. You care about your team and its software, and you continuously push for improvements in quality and speed. Together we will design, develop, deploy, release, run and support our applications. YOUR SKILLS INCLUDE: • Good experience in software engineering.• Experienced in JavaScript (NodeJS/React), Python, or other programming languages.• Interested with building microservices using cloud solutions (Serverless preferably on GCP)• Experience with web development and good understanding of API design.• Experience in working with GitHub, CI/CD, DevOps and Agile.• Experience with both SQL and NoSQL DBs. ABOUT THE TEAM We are based in Madrid (Spain), but also have fully remote team members distributed across Malmö/Helsingborg (Sweden), Amsterdam (Netherlands) and other parts of Europe. From now on we plan to meetup once or twice a week at the Madrid Digital Hub (San Sebastian de Los Reyes, Madrid). We are a new but rapid growing team (our hub was founded less than 2 years ago!). I love that together with our Data/UX/Product colleagues are able to prove new business and technology concepts in the IKEA stores across the globe and iterate and progressively create value for our customers and co-workers. So would you! Some of the perks that we offer: • A friendly workplace where you can always be yourself• Equal pay (Our salaries are set independently of race, gender, age or other individual characteristics)• Continuous learning on the job as well as structured trainings and platforms• Co-worker discount• Access to health insurance• World’s greatest colleagues And many more… :) QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT! If you have any questions about the position, please reach out to hiring manager Carlos Celorrio at carlos.celorrio@ingka.ikea.com. If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to Warren Roach at warren.roach@ingka.com. Warmly welcome with your application! Please note:Our primary concern since the outbreak of corona virus has been the health and safety of our co-workers and candidates. Because of this, we have adapted our recruiting processes to be fully digital. We would love to meet our candidates face to face, but to prevent the spread of the virus this recruitment will be handled through digital appointments and solutions.

Description:
DTN is a global leader providing insights and analytics to our customers to feed, fuel, and protect the world. We help people make critical business decisions that impact the agriculture, oil and gas, trading, and weather industries.

It’s a difference you’ve likely felt without even knowing it. From the food on your plate to the gas in your car to the last flight you took, chances are a DTN customer made it possible. And that’s just for starters. That’s why we say, “When our customers prosper, we all win.”
Job Description:
DTN – Weather Systems seeks a Software Development Engineer. This position plays a key role in building innovative software to deliver mission critical weather information to aeronautical and meteorological clients around the world including airports and national meteorological services.
Our product portfolio includes a market leading meteorological data acquisition, processing, and display software application called MetConsole©. As Software Development Engineer, you will be responsible for the implementation of software of the MetConsole© Aviation Weather Suite of products. Since 1984, DTN has evolved amidst a dynamic, ever-changing marketplace. We have always maintained our customer-centric focus. It is the critical key behind our must-have, best-in-class solutions.

Key Tasks & Responsibilities:
We are looking for a Big Data Engineer with experience in designing, building and managing applications to process large amounts of data in Google Cloud Platform. You’ll provide expert guidance to source and integrate structured and unstructured data from dozens of local data sources into a data lake.
As a Big Data Engineer, you will work closely with the team and our stakeholders to build and deliver solutions for a next generation Big Data analytics platform. You will have a focus on data streaming, data management, data quality, data security and deliver the systems that process huge volumes of data. Working with our Data Scientists to help drive the company strategy and marketing campaigns out to our customers.
At Vodafone, we don’t just produce creative products, we develop amazing people too. We are driven to empower people. We are committed to helping our people perform at their best and achieve their full potential.

5 years

Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.
The Role
Veeva Link supports the life sciences industry by building connected data applications to improve research and patient outcomes. It helps professionals to find the right people, e. g. clinical trials, education programs, or advisory boards. This streamlined access helps to reduce the time-to-market of essential drugs, conduct trials with the most relevant experts in the respective field, and spread information about new treatments to key people in the life science community. You can read more about Veeva Link on our product pages.

Job_title: Automation Software Engineer - Full Time Internship

Automation Software Engineer - Full Time Internship

This role has been designated as ‘Edge’, which means you will primarily work outside of an HPE office.
Job Description:

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

Job_title: Data and Analytics - IT Product Owner
Description:
The Position
Data & Analytics IT Product Owner/Business Analyst
Are you excited about Data? Do you believe that data can make the organisation become more successful and efficient in achieving its goals? Do you want to take charge and drive new and exciting data related initiatives and adoption of new concepts such as Data Mesh? Then your place is with us!
We are the Data & Analytics Chapter, part of Integrated Informatics at Roche. We build excellence and mastery in next generation data and analytics capabilities, including but not limited to Data Science, Data Engineering, Analytics and Data Management & Governance. We release value from data - all the way from Discovery to Insights.
In addition to partnering with teams across the business to develop solutions, scale and automate data pipelines, Data & Analytics Chapter members are uniquely placed to connect the dots across initiatives, promote information sharing across domains and recommend re-use of data, analytics and solutions wherever possible.

Description:
¿Qué podrás hacer?

ComoSeniorData Engineer, serás responsable de participar en el desarrollo de soluciones de Data Analytics en su sentido más amplio para las diferentes áreas de Tax & Legal de KPMG Abogados. Necesitamos a alguien como tú para que nos ayude en los siguientes ámbitos:
Comprensión de los problemas de negocio y su traducción a soluciones de Data Analytics.
Preparación de la infraestructura (Azure) y el ecosistema del que dependen el equipo de datos y lasbusiness units. integración diferentes soluciones dentro de un mismo entorno (por ejemplo, procesos de RPA)
Participación en el desarrollo de proyectos de automatización y ETL (Extract, Transform y Load)
Participarás en todo el ciclo completo de los proyectos.

Formarás parte de un equipo multidisciplinar integrado por diferentes perfiles STEAM con otras especialidades (RPA, UX/UI...) y las distintas áreas de negocio, todos cualificados en distintos campos tecnológicos.





FORMACIÓN

HABILIDADES & CONOCIMIENTOS




Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Job_title: Senior Data Software Engineer - (Malaga or Madrid)
Description:
Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

Description:
¿Quieres desarrollar tu carrera profesional allí donde hacemos realidad las ideaciones de nuestros clientes mediante el uso de las tecnologías más disruptivas y avanzadas del mercado? ¿Te encanta afrontar nuevos retos tecnológicos y liderar la transformación digital de nuestros clientes? ¿Buscas un ecosistema con proyectos nacionales e internacionales?

En el equipo de Artificial Intelligence & Data del Delivery Center de Deloitte contamos con un grupo de profesionales que se enfrentan constantemente al reto de aplicar tecnologías especializadas de última generación ayudando a nuestros clientes en sus procesos de constante transformación digital. Nuestros profesionales en continua formación disponen de amplios conocimientos en tecnologías del ámbito Cloud, Inteligencia Artificial y el mundo del Dato. Nuestras metodologías de trabajo ágiles nos permiten, junto a avanzadas herramientas y los aceleradores de desarrollo más punteros del mercado, poner soluciones en manos de nuestros clientes en un tiempo récord.

Actualmente, precisamos incorporar un/a Data Engineer con PySpark para integrarse en nuestro equipo de Deloitte de manera indefinida.

¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia profesional mínima 1 año en la transformación de datos a escala masiva basada tanto en servicios cloud como heramientas de integración de datos.
Python, Spark, PySpark.
Ingenierías o Grados en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas o Estadística.
Nivel de inglés alto, mínimo B2
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y espíritu de equipo.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico y flexible.
Disfrutar de 22 días de vacaciones además de 5 días en Navidad, 4 días en Semana Santa y jornada intensiva del 1 de Julio al 15 de septiembre.
Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
Participar en actividades y eventos extralaborales (Concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.

Estudios requeridos

Titulado universitario (en el ámbito de la ingeniería, telecomunicaciones, matemáticas, física...) o Ciclo de grado superior (en desarrollo de aplicaciones multiplataformas, desarrollo de aplicaciones web, ASIR o acorde)

Experiencia requerida

A partir de 2 años de experiencia (valorable a partir de 1 año)

Si quieres ver cómo tu trabajo tiene un impacto real en los clientes y personas, te gustan los retos tecnológicos y crees que nunca se deja de aprender… ¡Deloitte es tu sitio!

¿Aceptas el desafío?

Deloitte es una Firma de servicios profesionales firmemente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades. En este sentido, la Firma aceptará y tramitará solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad, no discriminando por motivos de sexo, expresión de género, raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, enfermedad o condición de salud, predisposición genética a sufrir patologías, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación o identidad sexual, situación socioeconómica o cualquier otra condición o circunstancia personal o social.

27982
