Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.

As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.

Education & Experience:

Description:
DTN is a global leader providing insights and analytics to our customers to feed, fuel, and protect the world. We help people make critical business decisions that impact the agriculture, oil and gas, trading, and weather industries.

It’s a difference you’ve likely felt without even knowing it. From the food on your plate to the gas in your car to the last flight you took, chances are a DTN customer made it possible. And that’s just for starters. That’s why we say, “When our customers prosper, we all win.”
Job Description:
DTN – Weather Systems seeks a Software Development Engineer. This position plays a key role in building innovative software to deliver mission critical weather information to aeronautical and meteorological clients around the world including airports and national meteorological services.
Our product portfolio includes a market leading meteorological data acquisition, processing, and display software application called MetConsole©. As Software Development Engineer, you will be responsible for the implementation of software of the MetConsole© Aviation Weather Suite of products. Since 1984, DTN has evolved amidst a dynamic, ever-changing marketplace. We have always maintained our customer-centric focus. It is the critical key behind our must-have, best-in-class solutions.

Job_title: Fullstack Software Engineer – Physical Meeting Points, Group Digital, Madrid
Description: If you are an amazing Software Engineer who wants to make a significant and meaningful contribution at an amazing company, then keep reading! WHO WE ARE Hi! I am Carlos and I lead a team as Engineering Manager at Ingka Digital (IKEA). We are looking for passionate engineers who are excited about technology and innovative ways of working and want to be a part of shaping the future of IKEA stores! Our team is responsible for developing digital solutions that will provide convenient, inspiring, and fun shopping experiences to our customers in our Physical Meeting Points (PMP). Also, we plan to transform and enhance processes for our co-workers in the IKEA stores. We are building a winning team with a clear mission and priorities! We are agile and adapt fast to changes. Engineers are not only delivering solutions but are also a part the core product team. Everything that we work on has great customer impact. We encourage every individual in the team to take part in and become customer obsessed. All this is done in an open and transparent way where trust is key and something we live by. Come join a growing team where you will have real customer impact! WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING Designing and implementing the backend services, frontend UI, data models, messaging and API specs. Developing high quality code using and applying good practices. Establishing standards and patterns, advocate adoption of technology both internally and towards the user groups in the PMP area. Working in an Agile way and with a DevOps mindset. Cross-team collaboration between web, app, cloud & backend, and embedded systems. Driving the product discovery, development and operation process within a multidisciplinary team (Product, Data, UX and Engineering) while contributing to the design and deployment of IKEA Digital In-Store solutions. WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU You share our vision of becoming the world’s leading multichannel home furnishing retailer and you believe good software is an essential ingredient of achieving that vision. We believe you have a great understanding of what simplicity and togetherness means. You know when to take and to give responsibility for what needs to be done. You care about your team and its software, and you continuously push for improvements in quality and speed. Together we will design, develop, deploy, release, run and support our applications. YOUR SKILLS INCLUDE: • Good experience in software engineering.• Experienced in JavaScript (NodeJS/React), Python, or other programming languages.• Interested with building microservices using cloud solutions (Serverless preferably on GCP)• Experience with web development and good understanding of API design.• Experience in working with GitHub, CI/CD, DevOps and Agile.• Experience with both SQL and NoSQL DBs. ABOUT THE TEAM We are based in Madrid (Spain), but also have fully remote team members distributed across Malmö/Helsingborg (Sweden), Amsterdam (Netherlands) and other parts of Europe. From now on we plan to meetup once or twice a week at the Madrid Digital Hub (San Sebastian de Los Reyes, Madrid). We are a new but rapid growing team (our hub was founded less than 2 years ago!). I love that together with our Data/UX/Product colleagues are able to prove new business and technology concepts in the IKEA stores across the globe and iterate and progressively create value for our customers and co-workers. So would you! Some of the perks that we offer: • A friendly workplace where you can always be yourself• Equal pay (Our salaries are set independently of race, gender, age or other individual characteristics)• Continuous learning on the job as well as structured trainings and platforms• Co-worker discount• Access to health insurance• World’s greatest colleagues And many more… :) QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT! If you have any questions about the position, please reach out to hiring manager Carlos Celorrio at carlos.celorrio@ingka.ikea.com. If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to Warren Roach at warren.roach@ingka.com. Warmly welcome with your application! Please note:Our primary concern since the outbreak of corona virus has been the health and safety of our co-workers and candidates. Because of this, we have adapted our recruiting processes to be fully digital. We would love to meet our candidates face to face, but to prevent the spread of the virus this recruitment will be handled through digital appointments and solutions.

Description:
Drive the future of collaborative open source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.
Launchpad is a platform for managing open source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.
Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). You'll be striking a balance between keeping our business-critical services running and expanding our feature set: among other things, we are currently working on expanding our package building capabilities, improving the development flows provided to our users, and modernising our web UI. If you love keeping large projects well-organised and well-maintained, care about supporting developers, and believe that continuous improvement is the key to innovation, higher velocity, and reliability, you'll fit right in.

Description:
Company Overview
Teledyne e2v Professional Imaging is an international leader in high performance, ultra-high resolution, and ultra-high speed image sensors and systems with approximately 220 employees globally. Acquired by Teledyne Technologies in 2017, Teledyne e2v Professional Imaging designs, develops, manufactures, and markets CMOS image sensors, modules, and imaging solutions for a variety of applications including machine vision and automation, medical and life sciences, logistics and robotics, and the environment, food and recycling. From 1D, 2D and 3D sensing to multi-spectral imaging, ultra-low noise, high sensitivity sensors rivalling EMCCDs, the range of our capabilities makes us a preferred innovation partner amongst our customers.

Our unique approach involves listening to the market and application challenges of our customers and partnering with them to provide the most leading edge standard, semi-custom, and fully custom imaging solutions.

Description:
Job Description:
Job Description
Dow Jones is seeking an engineer with extremely strong engineering skills to join a newly formed team, created as part of a strategic initiative that has identified some high growth opportunities for the organization. You'll also be working on market-leading flagship products on the latest in the Scala tech stack.
The team’s overarching goal is to develop a new generation of knowledge products, powered by technologies such as graph databases, ML/AI and cloud computing, aimed at extreme information users, both internally (e.g. in our newsrooms and Data Strategy teams) and externally. The team will seek to interconnect and harness all data and content available to Dow Jones and help our customers make sense in near-real time of how news events are impacting their world.

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.
As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.
Education & Experience:

Job_title: Senior Data Software Engineer - (Malaga or Madrid)
Description:
Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.
As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.
Education & Experience:

Description:
EPAM is the foremost global digital transformation services provider with over 59,000 EPAMers in more than 50 countries. Since 1993, our multidisciplinary teams have been helping make the future real for our clients and communities around the world. In 2018, we opened an office in Spain that quickly grew to over 1,000 EPAMers distributed between the Málaga office and remotely across the country. Here you will collaborate with multinational teams, contribute to numerous innovative projects, and have an opportunity to learn and grow continuously.
DESCRIPTION

Job_title: Senior Data Software Engineer - (Malaga or Madrid)
Description:
Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

Description:
Data Engineer (I&D)
¡Hola! Somos CAPGEMINI
Tenemos la gran suerte de trabajar en un sector que lidera la evolución hacia un futuro sostenible e inclusivo. La TECNOLOGÍA. El catalizador de tantas soluciones que necesitamos ahora más que nunca.
Somos 300.000 PERSONAS en todo el mundo unidas por una misma pasión.
No importa dónde estemos, podemos estar en casa, en la oficina, a mil quilómetros de distancia unxs de otrxs, pero somos conscientes de que NUESTRO TRABAJO CUENTA.
No importa en qué momento vital estemos, somos DIVERSOS en edad, género, ascendencia, familia… ¡nos hemos certificado en Diversidad y como empresa ÉTICA más de 9 años seguidos!
No importa si tu fase es de crecimiento, APRENDIENDO y FORMÁNDOTE a todas horas o si necesitas consolidarte y aprecias la FLEXIBILIDAD, la CONCILIACION y los BENEFICIOS fiscales y sociales para compaginar tu vida personal y profesional. Lo que importa es que puedes sentir que estás DONDE DEBES ESTAR para conseguir el futuro que deseas.
En cuanto al equipo, vas a poder trabajar con equipos diversos, para cada proyecto se constituye un equipo diferente, de distintas ciudades, por lo que tendrás relación con personas que están más allá de tu centro de trabajo o de tu lugar de residencia. Piensa que también colaboramos con otras sedes de Capgemini a nivel mundial… así que tu red de colegas no tendrá límite!!
Nuestro objetivo es poder brindar a nuestros clientes herramientas que le ayuden a tener éxito y conseguir sus propios objetivos. ¿Cómo? A través de nuestra excelencia en conocimiento y metodología, nuestra expertise y nuestro estilo de relación colaborativa con los clientes.

The area "Solution and Cross Functional Engineering" is responsible for the system design and development of cockpit systems, navigation and mission support systems, as well as the corresponding sensor technology for helicopters and aircraft.

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.
As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.
Education & Experience:

Description:
ShopFully is the tech company reinventing local shopping worldwide.

Thanks to our marketplaces we enable 45+ million users globally to save money and time when shopping at their favourite local stores. Our AI-driven platform helps 400+ retailers and top brands reach their ideal audiences and finally drive them to their stores, boosting local sales. This is why today we are one of the leading international players in Drive to Store.

We’re a team of over 370, spanning 30 different nationalities across 12 countries. Are you ready to join us?

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL

You will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable ETL processes towards the enterprise data warehouse and data lake
You will take care of everything related to the use of data to support the sale and improvement of our products (e.g. search for products loopholes), from the data ingestion phase to the visualization phase
your relational skills will be an advantage in the analysis and definition of data processes that meet business requirements
Our data platform is completely in the AWS cloud, it is modern and inspired by the big technological players and allows us to manage both batch and real-time applications.

SKILLS WE’RE SEARCHING FOR

You have a good knowledge of the SQL language and Python
You have knowledge of the basics of Big Data application development
You have knowledge of the cloud world and in particular AWS
You are able to work in a team and coordinate with multiple internal stakeholders

OTHER ABILITIES THAT WILL WIN OUR HEART

You have knowledge of the basics of the dimensional fact model and data warehousing
You have knowledge of at least one ETL tool (Pentaho Data Integration, Talend, etc.)
PySpark
It should be a plus also if you have knowledge of Tableau and R

THIS IS WHAT YOU’LL FIND IF YOU START THE ADVENTURE WITH US

Zero degrees of separation.
We are very informal, love direct feedback and work by project, so you’ll get a chance to meet everyone. Our CEO, CTO and C-anything will be your colleagues in some activities and you’ll get to work with all of us!

Massive impact.
You’ll work on tech & products that will be used by hundreds of retailers and brands and millions of people (from your friends, to your neighbours, and maybe even your mother!).

Problems that you’ll love to solve.
Here, you’ll discover that every challenge is an opportunity to thrive and make an impact.

The best team you’ve ever met.
We’re young and talented, without being divas, and we are supportive of each other. We share knowledge and are each other’s number one fans.

Learning and growing.
What do you think about 70 hours Learning Time a year and the possibility of getting tech certifications like AWS? But most importantly, at ShopFully you’ll be learning by doing and making mistakes, which will allow you to improve day after day.

Smart working, but even smarter.
each team can choose the ShopFully Hub that suits them better. Rome, Sidney or Barcelona? You’ll be spoilt for choice!

Fun, fun, fun!
It can be a happy hour, a volleyball match, a tandem ride, a Halloween party. You name it!

Lunches on us.
We give meal vouchers, also while working remotely. It’s a little thing, but we want to take care of it.

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.
As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.
Education & Experience:

Description:
Our incredibly multicultural and friendly team has proven itself as a major player in the mobile advertising landscape. To help us maintain our strong position in the industry, our Programmatic team is looking for a Programmatic Campaign Coordinator Intern to help us with our media-buying activity for clients. This is a 6-month full-time internship with the real possibility to become an employee afterwards subject to performance and results.
Your mission:
You will be responsible for setting up advertising campaigns, monitoring requests from team members and managing daily operational tasks such as campaign creation, updates, and reporting. You also will have to act as the main point of contact for some of your clients, and your global focus will be to grow the partnerships together on a daily basis. The right candidate will be keen to work in a team and have a problem-solving attitude.

We at PIA Media & PIA Digital Services are the agency for companies that think digitally about their marketing right from the start.
With more than 550 colleagues, we develop a consistent and cross-media customer experience for a wide range of customer groups of leading B2C and B2B companies - this end-to-end media approach is based on our broad knowledge and experience in content, technology, data and AI. PIA Media accompanies clients from the right media strategy to ad tech implementation, data analysis and management to the implementation of personalized campaigns on all platforms.
In addition to our offices in Hamburg, Munich, Düsseldorf and Berlin, we have two design and development hubs in Belgrade and Bucharest.
We are part of the PIA Group with over 1200 employees and 9 companies.

Job_title: Senior Data Software Engineer - (Malaga or Madrid)
Description:
Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

Description:
EPAM is the foremost global digital transformation services provider with over 59,000 EPAMers in more than 50 countries. Since 1993, our multidisciplinary teams have been helping make the future real for our clients and communities around the world. In 2018, we opened an office in Spain that quickly grew to over 1,000 EPAMers distributed between the Málaga office and remotely across the country. Here you will collaborate with multinational teams, contribute to numerous innovative projects, and have an opportunity to learn and grow continuously.
DESCRIPTION

Are you an open-minded professional with hands-on experience in Databricks or similar ETL Tools? If it sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Data Engineer. We are looking for a team player with excellent communication and organizational skills, mastery in engineering and B2+/C1 level of English to communicate fluently with English-speaking stakeholders, share ideas and provide reasoning.

As part of this project, our Data teams are working on migration of Data Products pipelines from Oracle workloads to Databricks. The team is composed of 3 engineers, 2 analysts and a Product Manager working in a highly agile environment, following XP practices and best CI/CD practices.

Founded in 2002, DerbySoft is a technology company whose mission is to make the travel business easier through industry leading technology that empowers travel industry services. Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.
As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.
Education & Experience:

Description:
Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

Description:
EPAM is the foremost global digital transformation services provider with over 59,000 EPAMers in more than 50 countries. Since 1993, our multidisciplinary teams have been helping make the future real for our clients and communities around the world. In 2018, we opened an office in Spain that quickly grew to over 1,000 EPAMers distributed between the Málaga office and remotely across the country. Here you will collaborate with multinational teams, contribute to numerous innovative projects, and have an opportunity to learn and grow continuously.
DESCRIPTION

Are you an open-minded professional with hands-on experience in Databricks or similar ETL Tools? If it sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Data Engineer. We are looking for a team player with excellent communication and organizational skills, mastery in engineering and B2+/C1 level of English to communicate fluently with English-speaking stakeholders, share ideas and provide reasoning.

As part of this project, our Data teams are working on migration of Data Products pipelines from Oracle workloads to Databricks. The team is composed of 3 engineers, 2 analysts and a Product Manager working in a highly agile environment, following XP practices and best CI/CD practices.

Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). The area "Solution and Cross Functional Engineering" is responsible for the system design and development of cockpit systems, navigation and mission support systems, as well as the corresponding sensor technology for helicopters and aircraft.

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.
As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.
Education & Experience:

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. Description:
Our incredibly multicultural and friendly team has proven itself as a major player in the mobile advertising landscape. To help us maintain our strong position in the industry, our Programmatic team is looking for a Programmatic Campaign Coordinator Intern to help us with our media-buying activity for clients. This is a 6-month full-time internship with the real possibility to become an employee afterwards subject to performance and results.
Your mission:
You will be responsible for setting up advertising campaigns, monitoring requests from team members and managing daily operational tasks such as campaign creation, updates, and reporting. You also will have to act as the main point of contact for some of your clients, and your global focus will be to grow the partnerships together on a daily basis. Desde Grupo Hasten estamos seleccionando perfiles de data engineer con experiencia con python y pyspark para trabajar con uno de nuestros importantes clientes con ubicación en Madrid.

EPAM is the foremost global digital transformation services provider with over 59,000 EPAMers in more than 50 countries. Since 1993, our multidisciplinary teams have been helping make the future real for our clients and communities around the world. In 2018, we opened an office in Spain that quickly grew to over 1,000 EPAMers distributed between the Málaga office and remotely across the country. Here you will collaborate with multinational teams, contribute to numerous innovative projects, and have an opportunity to learn and grow continuously.
DESCRIPTION

Are you an open-minded professional with hands-on experience in Databricks or similar ETL Tools? If it sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Data Engineer. We are looking for a team player with excellent communication and organizational skills, mastery in engineering and B2+/C1 level of English to communicate fluently with English-speaking stakeholders, share ideas and provide reasoning.

As part of this project, our Data teams are working on migration of Data Products pipelines from Oracle workloads to Databricks. The team is composed of 3 engineers, 2 analysts and a Product Manager working in a highly agile environment, following XP practices and best CI/CD practices.

Description:
Data Engineer (I&D)
¡Hola! Somos CAPGEMINI
Tenemos la gran suerte de trabajar en un sector que lidera la evolución hacia un futuro sostenible e inclusivo. La TECNOLOGÍA. El catalizador de tantas soluciones que necesitamos ahora más que nunca.
Somos 300.000 PERSONAS en todo el mundo unidas por una misma pasión.
No importa dónde estemos, podemos estar en casa, en la oficina, a mil quilómetros de distancia unxs de otrxs, pero somos conscientes de que NUESTRO TRABAJO CUENTA.
No importa en qué momento vital estemos, somos DIVERSOS en edad, género, ascendencia, familia… ¡nos hemos certificado en Diversidad y como empresa ÉTICA más de 9 años seguidos!

You will have the opportunity to leverage analytical methodologies to deliver value to BCG's Consulting (case) teams and Practice Areas (domain) through providing analytics subject matter expertise, and accelerated execution support.

You will collaborate with case teams to gather requirements, specify, design, develop, deliver and support analytic solutions serving client needs. You will provide technical support through deeper understanding of relevant data analytics solutions and processes to build high quality and efficient analytic solutions.









You should be strong in analytical solutioning with hands on experience in advanced analytics delivery, through the entire life cycle of analytics. Strong analytics skills with the ability to develop and codify knowledge and provide analytical advice where required

Description:
Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.
Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.
As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.
Education & Experience:

Our incredibly multicultural and friendly team has proven itself as a major player in the mobile advertising landscape. To help us maintain our strong position in the industry, our Programmatic team is looking for a Programmatic Campaign Coordinator Intern to help us with our media-buying activity for clients. You will be responsible for setting up advertising campaigns, monitoring requests from team members and managing daily operational tasks such as campaign creation, updates, and reporting. Description:
We at PIA Media & PIA Digital Services are the agency for companies that think digitally about their marketing right from the start.
With more than 550 colleagues, we develop a consistent and cross-media customer experience for a wide range of customer groups of leading B2C and B2B companies - this end-to-end media approach is based on our broad knowledge and experience in content, technology, data and AI. PIA Media accompanies clients from the right media strategy to ad tech implementation, data analysis and management to the implementation of personalized campaigns on all platforms.
In addition to our offices in Hamburg, Munich, Düsseldorf and Berlin, we have two design and development hubs in Belgrade and Bucharest.
We are part of the PIA Group with over 1200 employees and 9 companies.

Job_title: Senior Data Software Engineer - (Malaga or Madrid)
Description:
Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

EPAM is the foremost global digital transformation services provider with over 59,000 EPAMers in more than 50 countries. Since 1993, our multidisciplinary teams have been helping make the future real for our clients and communities around the world. In 2018, we opened an office in Spain that quickly grew to over 1,000 EPAMers distributed between the Málaga office and remotely across the country. Here you will collaborate with multinational teams, contribute to numerous innovative projects, and have an opportunity to learn and grow continuously.
DESCRIPTION

Are you an open-minded professional with hands-on experience in Databricks or similar ETL Tools? If it sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Data Engineer. We are looking for a team player with excellent communication and organizational skills, mastery in engineering and B2+/C1 level of English to communicate fluently with English-speaking stakeholders, share ideas and provide reasoning.

As part of this project, our Data teams are working on migration of Data Products pipelines from Oracle workloads to Databricks. The team is composed of 3 engineers, 2 analysts and a Product Manager working in a highly agile environment, following XP practices and best CI/CD practices.

What is Derbysoft?*
Founded in 2002, DerbySoft is a technology company whose mission is to make the travel business easier through industry leading technology that empowers travel industry services. The company supports technology for Connectivity Services at the CRS and PMS levels, Marketing Services which uses machine learning and rich data to drive high-performing marketing campaigns and a Content platform that collects, manages and distributes quality hotel content. DerbySoft’s technology empowers the travel industry around the globe. Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, USA and with offices in Barcelona, Tokyo and Shanghai, DerbySoft serves partners in 197 countries around the world.

Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

Job_title: Systems Engineer Future Combat Air System Relocation to Germany (f/m/d)
Description:
For the area "Solution and Cross Functional Engineering" we are looking for a "System Engineer Future Combat Air System (f/m/d)" at the location Immenstaad or Ulm in Germany as soon as possible.
The area "Solution and Cross Functional Engineering" is responsible for the system design and development of cockpit systems, navigation and mission support systems, as well as the corresponding sensor technology for helicopters and aircraft.
In the Future Combat Air System (FCAS) core team, you will contribute to the overall system design to meet future needs of the European Air Force for the next decades.
You will collaborate with national and European industrial partners, research institutes, customers and armed forces.

Job Description:
Job Description
Dow Jones is seeking an engineer with extremely strong engineering skills to join a newly formed team, created as part of a strategic initiative that has identified some high growth opportunities for the organization. You'll also be working on market-leading flagship products on the latest in the Scala tech stack.
The team’s overarching goal is to develop a new generation of knowledge products, powered by technologies such as graph databases, ML/AI and cloud computing, aimed at extreme information users, both internally (e.g. in our newsrooms and Data Strategy teams) and externally. The team will seek to interconnect and harness all data and content available to Dow Jones and help our customers make sense in near-real time of how news events are impacting their world.

Description:
Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

Description:
EPAM is the foremost global digital transformation services provider with over 59,000 EPAMers in more than 50 countries. Are you an open-minded professional with hands-on experience in Databricks or similar ETL Tools? If it sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Data Engineer. ¡Hola! Somos CAPGEMINI
Tenemos la gran suerte de trabajar en un sector que lidera la evolución hacia un futuro sostenible e inclusivo. La TECNOLOGÍA. El catalizador de tantas soluciones que necesitamos ahora más que nunca.
Somos 300.000 PERSONAS en todo el mundo unidas por una misma pasión.
No importa dónde estemos, podemos estar en casa, en la oficina, a mil quilómetros de distancia unxs de otrxs, pero somos conscientes de que NUESTRO TRABAJO CUENTA.
No importa en qué momento vital estemos, somos DIVERSOS en edad, género, ascendencia, familia… ¡nos hemos certificado en Diversidad y como empresa ÉTICA más de 9 años seguidos!
No importa si tu fase es de crecimiento, APRENDIENDO y FORMÁNDOTE a todas horas o si necesitas consolidarte y aprecias la FLEXIBILIDAD, la CONCILIACION y los BENEFICIOS fiscales y sociales para compaginar tu vida personal y profesional. Lo que importa es que puedes sentir que estás DONDE DEBES ESTAR para conseguir el futuro que deseas.
En cuanto al equipo, vas a poder trabajar con equipos diversos, para cada proyecto se constituye un equipo diferente, de distintas ciudades, por lo que tendrás relación con personas que están más allá de tu centro de trabajo o de tu lugar de residencia. Piensa que también colaboramos con otras sedes de Capgemini a nivel mundial… así que tu red de colegas no tendrá límite!!
Nuestro objetivo es poder brindar a nuestros clientes herramientas que le ayuden a tener éxito y conseguir sus propios objetivos. ¿Cómo? A través de nuestra excelencia en conocimiento y metodología, nuestra expertise y nuestro estilo de relación colaborativa con los clientes.

Description:
zenital offers quality data services that empower brand new solutions. We are currently looking for a Data Engineer to help us to achieve the next level in our goal to transform how people understands and works with data.
We are working in mid-market international customers such as airlines, logistic operators and consumer products distributors with modern data architectures and honest long-term relationships allowing us to excel at our work.

Requirements:
Be a nice person and empathetic
Strong technical skills and data engineering fundamentals

Estamos ampliando el equipo de FS Consulting en nuestra oficina de Zaragoza, con un Data Engineer para realizar procesos de ETLs y uso de herramientas de reporting como PowerBI.

¿Qué necesitas saber?


Programador DAM o DAW
Experiencia mínima: 2 años
Experiencia previa en consultoría o prestación de servicios al cliente. Deseable proyectos previos en entorno bancario y conocimiento de productos bancarios (hipotecas, consumo etc.)




Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

Job_title: Project Manager / Engineer Smart Cities & Smart Grids (m/f/x)
Description:
About Us
With over 2.000 employees, Fichtner is Germany’s leading independent planning and consultancy enterprise. We are global players and tackle challenging projects in more than 100 countries. Among our clients are companies from the sectors of central utility supplies and waste management, international development and commercial banks, investors, public administrations, and energy-intensive industrial enterprises. We offer our clients a unique combination of engineering consultancy with classical management consultancy.
We are looking to fill a permanent position at our new Madrid office as soon as possible with a long-term oriented and highly motivated

Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

As a part of BCG’s GAMMA team - part of BCG X, you will work closely with consulting teams on a diverse range of advanced analytics topics. You will have the opportunity to leverage analytical methodologies to deliver value to BCG's Consulting (case) teams and Practice Areas (domain) through providing analytics subject matter expertise, and accelerated execution support.

You will collaborate with case teams to gather requirements, specify, design, develop, deliver and support analytic solutions serving client needs. You will provide technical support through deeper understanding of relevant data analytics solutions and processes to build high quality and efficient analytic solutions.









You should be strong in analytical solutioning with hands on experience in advanced analytics delivery, through the entire life cycle of analytics. Strong analytics skills with the ability to develop and codify knowledge and provide analytical advice where required

Description:
Job Title: Technical Service Engineer
Location: Barcelona, Spain
Supervisor Title: Manager, Technical Services
*
What is Derbysoft?*
Founded in 2002, DerbySoft is a technology company whose mission is to make the travel business easier through industry leading technology that empowers travel industry services. The company supports technology for Connectivity Services at the CRS and PMS levels, Marketing Services which uses machine learning and rich data to drive high-performing marketing campaigns and a Content platform that collects, manages and distributes quality hotel content. DerbySoft’s technology empowers the travel industry around the globe. Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, USA and with offices in Barcelona, Tokyo and Shanghai, DerbySoft serves partners in 197 countries around the world.

Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

Job_title: Systems Engineer Future Combat Air System Relocation to Germany (f/m/d)
Description:
For the area "Solution and Cross Functional Engineering" we are looking for a "System Engineer Future Combat Air System (f/m/d)" at the location Immenstaad or Ulm in Germany as soon as possible.
The area "Solution and Cross Functional Engineering" is responsible for the system design and development of cockpit systems, navigation and mission support systems, as well as the corresponding sensor technology for helicopters and aircraft.
In the Future Combat Air System (FCAS) core team, you will contribute to the overall system design to meet future needs of the European Air Force for the next decades.
You will collaborate with national and European industrial partners, research institutes, customers and armed forces.
Your Tasks

Job_title: Lead Data Engineer (Google Cloud, Scala, CI/CD)
Description:
Job Description:
Job Description
Dow Jones is seeking an engineer with extremely strong engineering skills to join a newly formed team, created as part of a strategic initiative that has identified some high growth opportunities for the organization. You'll also be working on market-leading flagship products on the latest in the Scala tech stack.
The team’s overarching goal is to develop a new generation of knowledge products, powered by technologies such as graph databases, ML/AI and cloud computing, aimed at extreme information users, both internally (e.g. in our newsrooms and Data Strategy teams) and externally. The team will seek to interconnect and harness all data and content available to Dow Jones and help our customers make sense in near-real time of how news events are impacting their world.

Description:
Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.
Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us

About the Role
Our engineering teams' guiding principle and its philosophy have always been to get things right through practicing disciplined engineering, not cutting corners, and of course having fun while we are at it. We believe in ensuring ownership at all levels of the organization and empowering teams. If this culture is for you, you will learn a lot while enjoying everyday and staying abreast with industry technologies and practices working with a large engineering team.
The Professional Information Business Engineering Team is looking for a Lead Software Engineer based in Barcelona, who will manage the development, integration, support and maintenance of content processing and editorial applications and ensure that they follow established SDLC policies, procedures and guidelines. We are looking for creative and passionate engineers who want to be hands-on, implement and own code all the way through deployment and in production.

Description:
Our incredibly multicultural and friendly team has proven itself as a major player in the mobile advertising landscape. To help us maintain our strong position in the industry, our Programmatic team is looking for a Programmatic Campaign Coordinator Intern to help us with our media-buying activity for clients. This is a 6-month full-time internship with the real possibility to become an employee afterwards subject to performance and results.
Your mission:
You will be responsible for setting up advertising campaigns, monitoring requests from team members and managing daily operational tasks such as campaign creation, updates, and reporting. You also will have to act as the main point of contact for some of your clients, and your global focus will be to grow the partnerships together on a daily basis. The right candidate will be keen to work in a team and have a problem-solving attitude.

Job_title: Senior Data Software Engineer - (Malaga or Madrid)
Description:
Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

We at PIA Media & PIA Digital Services are the agency for companies that think digitally about their marketing right from the start.
With more than 550 colleagues, we develop a consistent and cross-media customer experience for a wide range of customer groups of leading B2C and B2B companies - this end-to-end media approach is based on our broad knowledge and experience in content, technology, data and AI. PIA Media accompanies clients from the right media strategy to ad tech implementation, data analysis and management to the implementation of personalized campaigns on all platforms.
In addition to our offices in Hamburg, Munich, Düsseldorf and Berlin, we have two design and development hubs in Belgrade and Bucharest.
We are part of the PIA Group with over 1200 employees and 9 companies.

Desde Grupo Hasten estamos seleccionando perfiles de data engineer con experiencia con python y pyspark para trabajar con uno de nuestros importantes clientes con ubicación en Madrid.
– Se trabajará en remoto en un 90%.

EPAM is the foremost global digital transformation services provider with over 59,000 EPAMers in more than 50 countries. Since 1993, our multidisciplinary teams have been helping make the future real for our clients and communities around the world. In 2018, we opened an office in Spain that quickly grew to over 1,000 EPAMers distributed between the Málaga office and remotely across the country. Here you will collaborate with multinational teams, contribute to numerous innovative projects, and have an opportunity to learn and grow continuously.
DESCRIPTION

Are you an open-minded professional with hands-on experience in Databricks or similar ETL Tools? If it sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Data Engineer. We are looking for a team player with excellent communication and organizational skills, mastery in engineering and B2+/C1 level of English to communicate fluently with English-speaking stakeholders, share ideas and provide reasoning.

As part of this project, our Data teams are working on migration of Data Products pipelines from Oracle workloads to Databricks. The team is composed of 3 engineers, 2 analysts and a Product Manager working in a highly agile environment, following XP practices and best CI/CD practices.

Description:
Data Engineer (I&D)
¡Hola! Somos CAPGEMINI
Tenemos la gran suerte de trabajar en un sector que lidera la evolución hacia un futuro sostenible e inclusivo. La TECNOLOGÍA. El catalizador de tantas soluciones que necesitamos ahora más que nunca.
Somos 300.000 PERSONAS en todo el mundo unidas por una misma pasión.
No importa dónde estemos, podemos estar en casa, en la oficina, a mil quilómetros de distancia unxs de otrxs, pero somos conscientes de que NUESTRO TRABAJO CUENTA.
No importa en qué momento vital estemos, somos DIVERSOS en edad, género, ascendencia, familia… ¡nos hemos certificado en Diversidad y como empresa ÉTICA más de 9 años seguidos!
No importa si tu fase es de crecimiento, APRENDIENDO y FORMÁNDOTE a todas horas o si necesitas consolidarte y aprecias la FLEXIBILIDAD, la CONCILIACION y los BENEFICIOS fiscales y sociales para compaginar tu vida personal y profesional. Lo que importa es que puedes sentir que estás DONDE DEBES ESTAR para conseguir el futuro que deseas.
En cuanto al equipo, vas a poder trabajar con equipos diversos, para cada proyecto se constituye un equipo diferente, de distintas ciudades, por lo que tendrás relación con personas que están más allá de tu centro de trabajo o de tu lugar de residencia. Piensa que también colaboramos con otras sedes de Capgemini a nivel mundial… así que tu red de colegas no tendrá límite!!
Nuestro objetivo es poder brindar a nuestros clientes herramientas que le ayuden a tener éxito y conseguir sus propios objetivos. ¿Cómo? A través de nuestra excelencia en conocimiento y metodología, nuestra expertise y nuestro estilo de relación colaborativa con los clientes.

Founded in 2002, DerbySoft is a technology company whose mission is to make the travel business easier through industry leading technology that empowers travel industry services. The company supports technology for Connectivity Services at the CRS and PMS levels, Marketing Services which uses machine learning and rich data to drive high-performing marketing campaigns and a Content platform that collects, manages and distributes quality hotel content. Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

Job_title: Systems Engineer Future Combat Air System Relocation to Germany (f/m/d)
Description:
For the area "Solution and Cross Functional Engineering" we are looking for a "System Engineer Future Combat Air System (f/m/d)" at the location Immenstaad or Ulm in Germany as soon as possible.
The area "Solution and Cross Functional Engineering" is responsible for the system design and development of cockpit systems, navigation and mission support systems, as well as the corresponding sensor technology for helicopters and aircraft.
In the Future Combat Air System (FCAS) core team, you will contribute to the overall system design to meet future needs of the European Air Force for the next decades.
You will collaborate with national and European industrial partners, research institutes, customers and armed forces.

Job Description
Dow Jones is seeking an engineer with extremely strong engineering skills to join a newly formed team, created as part of a strategic initiative that has identified some high growth opportunities for the organization. Who we are
The Workshop is a tech company that develops incredible software for the online gaming industry. Living by the motto “Fearlessly Forward,” innovation is at the centre of everything we do, whether it’s our games, new products and technologies. We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes.
Our strength lies in the diversity of our skills, and that comes from the diversity of our people. The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof,) and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a pleasant, supportive place to work – whoever you are. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and move Fearlessly Forward.

Description:
EPAM is the foremost global digital transformation services provider with over 59,000 EPAMers in more than 50 countries. Here you will collaborate with multinational teams, contribute to numerous innovative projects, and have an opportunity to learn and grow continuously.
DESCRIPTION

Are you an open-minded professional with hands-on experience in Databricks or similar ETL Tools? If it sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Data Engineer. We are looking for a team player with excellent communication and organizational skills, mastery in engineering and B2+/C1 level of English to communicate fluently with English-speaking stakeholders, share ideas and provide reasoning.

As part of this project, our Data teams are working on migration of Data Products pipelines from Oracle workloads to Databricks. The team is composed of 3 engineers, 2 analysts and a Product Manager working in a highly agile environment, following XP practices and best CI/CD practices.

Description:
Data Engineer (I&D)
¡Hola! Somos CAPGEMINI
Tenemos la gran suerte de trabajar en un sector que lidera la evolución hacia un futuro sostenible e inclusivo. La TECNOLOGÍA. El catalizador de tantas soluciones que necesitamos ahora más que nunca.
Somos 300.000 PERSONAS en todo el mundo unidas por una misma pasión.
No importa dónde estemos, podemos estar en casa, en la oficina, a mil quilómetros de distancia unxs de otrxs, pero somos conscientes de que NUESTRO TRABAJO CUENTA.
No importa en qué momento vital estemos, somos DIVERSOS en edad, género, ascendencia, familia… ¡nos hemos certificado en Diversidad y como empresa ÉTICA más de 9 años seguidos!
No importa si tu fase es de crecimiento, APRENDIENDO y FORMÁNDOTE a todas horas o si necesitas consolidarte y aprecias la FLEXIBILIDAD, la CONCILIACION y los BENEFICIOS fiscales y sociales para compaginar tu vida personal y profesional. Lo que importa es que puedes sentir que estás DONDE DEBES ESTAR para conseguir el futuro que deseas.
En cuanto al equipo, vas a poder trabajar con equipos diversos, para cada proyecto se constituye un equipo diferente, de distintas ciudades, por lo que tendrás relación con personas que están más allá de tu centro de trabajo o de tu lugar de residencia. Piensa que también colaboramos con otras sedes de Capgemini a nivel mundial… así que tu red de colegas no tendrá límite!!
Nuestro objetivo es poder brindar a nuestros clientes herramientas que le ayuden a tener éxito y conseguir sus propios objetivos. ¿Cómo? A través de nuestra excelencia en conocimiento y metodología, nuestra expertise y nuestro estilo de relación colaborativa con los clientes.

Description:

As a part of BCG’s GAMMA team - part of BCG X, you will work closely with consulting teams on a diverse range of advanced analytics topics. Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

Job_title: Lead Data Engineer (Google Cloud, Scala, CI/CD)
Description:
Job Description:
Job Description
Dow Jones is seeking an engineer with extremely strong engineering skills to join a newly formed team, created as part of a strategic initiative that has identified some high growth opportunities for the organization. You'll also be working on market-leading flagship products on the latest in the Scala tech stack.
The team’s overarching goal is to develop a new generation of knowledge products, powered by technologies such as graph databases, ML/AI and cloud computing, aimed at extreme information users, both internally (e.g. in our newsrooms and Data Strategy teams) and externally. The team will seek to interconnect and harness all data and content available to Dow Jones and help our customers make sense in near-real time of how news events are impacting their world.

Description:
Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.
Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us
